section.para: set stat attributes for a file and fetch new values. If the object is a symlink the link itself is modified. See dfs_stat() for which entries are filled.

section.title: dfs_set_prefix()

para.computeroutput: int dfs_set_prefix (dfs_t * dfs, const char * prefix)

section.para: Optionally set a prefix on the dfs mount where all paths passed to dfs_lookup are trimmed off that prefix. This is helpful when using DFS API with a dfuse mount and the user would like to reference files in the dfuse mount instead of the absolute path from the root of the DFS container.

entry.para: Pointer to the mounted file system.
absolute prefix to trim off path to dfs_lookup. Passing NULL unsets the prefix.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: 0 on success, errno code on failure.

section.title: dfs_setxattr()

para.computeroutput: int dfs_setxattr (dfs_t * dfs, dfs_obj_t * obj, const char * name, const void * value, daos_size_t size, int flags)

section.para: Set extended attribute on an open object (File, dir, syml). If object is a symlink, the value is set on the symlink itself.

entry.para: Pointer to the mounted file system.
Open object where xattr will be added.
Name of xattr to add.
Value of xattr.
Size in bytes of the value.
Set flags. passing 0 does not check for xattr existence. XATTR_CREATE: create or fail if xattr exists. XATTR_REPLACE: replace or fail if xattr does not exist.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: 0 on success, errno code on failure.

section.title: dfs_stat()

para.computeroutput: int dfs_stat (dfs_t * dfs, dfs_obj_t * parent, const char * name, struct stat * stbuf)

section.para: stat attributes of an entry. If object is a symlink, the link itself is interogated. The following elements of the stat struct are populated (the rest are set to 0): mode_t st_mode; uid_t st_uid; gid_t st_gid; off_t st_size; blkcnt_t st_blocks struct timespec st_atim; struct timespec st_mtim; struct timespec st_ctim;

entry.para: Pointer to the mounted file system.
Opened parent directory object. If NULL, use root obj.
Link name of the object. Can be NULL if parent is root, which means operation will be on root object.
Stat struct with the members above filled.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: 0 on success, errno code on failure.

section.title: dfs_update_parent()

para.computeroutput: int dfs_update_parent (dfs_obj_t * obj, dfs_obj_t * src_obj, const char * name)

section.para: A DFS object open handle has links to its parent (oid) and the entry name of that object in that parent. In some cases a user would want to update the oh of an object in case of a rename. This API would allow modifying an existing open handle of an object to change it's parent and it's entry name. Note this is a local operation and doesn't change anything on the storage.

entry.para: Open object handle to update.
Open object handle of the object whose parent will be used as the new parent of obj.
Optional new name of entry in parent. Pass NULL to leave the entry name unchanged.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: 0 on Success. errno code on Failure.
